conference-2025.title: 102nd Annual NHBEA Conference
conference-2025.description: Join us for the 102nd Annual New Hampshire Business Education Association Conference featuring workshops on Marketing & AI, Financial Literacy, Work-Study Programs, and Early College High School programs. Network with fellow educators and gain valuable insights to ignite your future in business education!

speakers.name: Rony Camille
speakers.title: Media Manager
speakers.bio: A communications and public affairs executive with 20+ years of experience. My career bridges journalism, digital media, and municipal leadership. At ABC News, I produced and edited stories that reached millions across broadcast and digital platforms. At WBZ NewsRadio/iHeartMedia, I drove more than 1.2 million unique digital views. In municipal leadership for Tyngsborough, Massachusetts, I increased website traffic by 1,800% and secured $250K+ in federal funding to expand civic engagement infrastructure.

speakers.name: Stephen Lynn
speakers.title: Vice President, Branch Leader
speakers.bio: Steve Lynn is a seasoned financial services executive currently serving as the VP and Branch Leader at Fidelity Investments in Nashua, New Hampshire. With over 17 years at Fidelity, he demonstrates strong commitment to client service and operational excellence. His extensive experience in the financial investment sector has equipped him with a deep understanding of market dynamics and customer needs.

speakers.name: Major Wheelock
speakers.title: ECHS Coordinator
speakers.bio: 20 years' experience as a successful Leader/Operations Manager. Actively engages with students and successfully manages enrollment and retention. Developed continuous training programs for academic advisors, staff, and faculty. Exceptional decision-making and problem-solving skills in student-focused environments.

speakers.name: Drew Lambert
speakers.title: Founder, Senior Salesforce Engineer
speakers.bio: Drew Lambert is a Senior Salesforce Engineer at Bevi and founder of Revelate Operations LLC. With deep expertise in Salesforce architecture, process optimization, and AI-driven automation, Drew has transformed how teams operate by designing scalable solutions. His consulting practice focuses on helping organizations unlock growth through RevOps strategy and AI agents.

speakers.name: Dean Graziano, J.D.
speakers.title: Vice President of Corporate Work-Study
speakers.bio: A multi-state award-winning educator with over 29 years in education. Selected as the State of New Hampshire's Extended Learning Opportunity Coordinator-of-the-Year in 2017. Work-force pilot program in Rochester, NH was singled out by Governor Sununu as the model for the State of NH Career Academies.

speakers.name: Maria Matarazzo
speakers.title: Professor and Chair
speakers.organization: UMass Lowell, Manning School of Business
speakers.bio: Maria Matarazzo is an experienced professor and Chair with a demonstrated history of successfully achieving organizational goals in higher education. Maria was awarded Teacher of the Year for the state of New Hampshire in Business Education.

speakers.name: James Dowding
speakers.title: Business Educator
speakers.bio: A versatile educator with significant academic and business experience. Currently serving as an Accounting/Finance teacher at the Academy of Finance with the Nashua Technology Center.

speakers.name: Catherine Lambert, MS MEd CAGS
speakers.title: Licensed Mental Health Counselor
speakers.bio: Licensed Mental Health Counselor in New Hampshire and Massachusetts, and founder of Therosa Counseling, LLC. She developed The Scenic Path — a therapeutic framework that blends clinical models with a visual, metaphorical journey toward authenticity.

sessions.title: Registration
sessions.description: Check-in and registration for conference attendees

sessions.title: Keynote Address: The Future of Communication in Education
sessions.description: Communications and public affairs executive Rony Camille shares insights from 20+ years bridging journalism, digital media, and municipal leadership.
sessions.speaker: rony-camille
learningObjectives: Understand modern communication strategies for educational settings
Learn how to leverage digital media for civic engagement
Discover approaches to build trust and transparency through communication

sessions.title: NH Graduation Requirements – Financial Literacy
sessions.description: Explore New Hampshire's financial literacy graduation requirements and strategies for improving outcomes in your classroom.
sessions.speaker: stephen-lynn
learningObjectives: Improve student outcomes in financial education

sessions.title: Early College High School
sessions.description: Learn about Early College High School programs and how to successfully manage enrollment and retention.
sessions.speaker: major-wheelock
learningObjectives: Explore student support services in ECHS

sessions.title: Marketing and AI
sessions.description: Discover how AI is transforming marketing education and explore practical applications for the classroom.
sessions.speaker: drew-lambert
learningObjectives: Understand AI applications in modern marketing
Explore AI tools for classroom use
Learn automation strategies for business processes

sessions.title: Work-Study Programs
sessions.description: Explore innovative work-study program models and learn how to implement CTE/WBL programming in your school.
sessions.speaker: dean-graziano
learningObjectives: Learn about NH Career Academy models

sessions.title: Marketing, Entrepreneurship & Innovation
sessions.description: Cellphone and Technology Policies in the Classroom that Address New NH State Law
sessions.speaker: maria-matarazzo

sessions.title: The Global Spin
sessions.description: Interactive roundtable discussion on global business perspectives
sessions.speaker: james-dowding

sessions.title: Trauma in the Classroom
sessions.description: Understanding and addressing trauma in educational settings
sessions.speaker: catherine-lambert

sessions.title: Election of 2026 Officers
sessions.description: Vote for the 2026 NHBEA Officer slate
